content.heading: Your domicile
content.paragraph1: Your domicile is usually the place in which you were born, regard as your permanent home and to which you have the closest ties.
content.paragraph2: However, domicile can be more complex, for example if you or your parents have moved countries in the past.
content.helpText1: You should select yes if either of the following types of domicile in England or Wales apply.
content.helpText2:
When you're born, you acquire a domicile of origin. This is usually:
  • the country your father was domiciled in if your parents were married
  • the country your mother was domiciled in if your parents were unmarried, or your father had died before you were born
content.helpText3: If you leave your domicile of origin and settle in another country as an adult, the new country may become your domicile of choice.
content.helpText4: If you're not sure about your domicile you should get legal advice.

content.heading: Eich domisil
content.paragraph1: Eich domisil, fel arfer, yw’r lle y cawsoch eich geni, y lle yr ydych yn meddwl amdano fel eich cartref parhaol a’r lle mae eich teulu a’ch ffrindiau agosaf yn byw.
content.paragraph2: Ond, mae’n bosib i’ch domisil fod yn fwy cymhleth, er enghraifft os ydych chi neu eich rhieni wedi symud o un wlad i’r llall yn y gorffennol.
content.helpText1: Dylech ddewis Ydy os oes gennych un o’r ddau fath o ddomisil yng Nghymru neu Loegr yn berthnasol.
content.helpText2:
Pan rydych yn cael eich geni, rydych yn cael mamwlad. Fel arfer, eich:
  • yw’r wlad yr oedd eich tad â’i ddomisil ynddi os oedd eich rhieni’n briod
  • y wlad yr oedd eich mam â’i domisil ynddi os nad oedd yn briod, neu os oedd eich tad wedi marw cyn eich geni
content.helpText3: Os byddwch yn gadael eich mamwlad ac yn ymsefydlu mewn gwlad arall fel oedolyn, efallai y daw’r wlad honno yn ddomisil drwy ddewis ichi.
content.helpText4: Os nad ydych chi’n siwr am eich domisil, dylech ofyn am gyngor cyfreithiol.
